long_description: GTree is a SQL-GR function used for analyzing hierarchical data.

input_tables.name: vertices
input_tables.rDescription: The table defining the set of vertices in the graph.
input_tables.description: The table defining the set of vertices in the graph.

input_tables.name: edges
input_tables.rDescription: The table defining the set of edges in the graph.
input_tables.description: The table defining the set of edges in the graph.

input_tables.name: root
input_tables.rDescription: The table defining the set of vertices from which GTree will start traversing the graph.
input_tables.description: The table defining the set of vertices from which GTree will start traversing the graph.

argument_clauses.name: TargetKey
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns in the edges table that identify the target vertex of an edge.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns in the edges table that identify the target vertex of an edge.

argument_clauses.name: AllowCycles
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the input graph can include cycles. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the input graph can include cycles. The default value is 'false'.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum depth to which the function traverses the graph (a nonnegative integer). The default value is 1000.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum depth to which the function traverses the graph (a nonnegative integer). The default value is 1000.

argument_clauses.name: Output
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function outputs all paths ('all') or only paths that end by reaching a leaf vertex, a cycle, or the maximum number of iterations ('end'). The default value is 'end'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the function outputs all paths ('all') or only paths that end by reaching a leaf vertex, a cycle, or the maximum number of iterations ('end'). The default value is 'end'.

argument_clauses.name: Results
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the aggregate functions that the function calculates along each vertex in each path. The function outputs one column of results for each aggregate function. The column name is alias, if specified; otherwise it is func(expr).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the aggregate functions that the function calculates along each vertex in each path. The function outputs one column of results for each aggregate function. The column name is alias, if specified; otherwise it is func(expr).

argument_clauses.name: EdgeResults
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the aggregate functions that the function calculates along each edge in each path. The function outputs one column of results for each aggregate function. The column name is alias, if specified; otherwise it is func(expr).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the aggregate functions that the function calculates along each edge in each path. The function outputs one column of results for each aggregate function. The column name is alias, if specified; otherwise it is func(expr).

argument_clauses.name: FinalEdgeFlag
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function includes the edge that follows the final vertex when calculating the functions that edge.results specifies. The default value is 'true'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the function includes the edge that follows the final vertex when calculating the functions that EdgeResults specifies. The default value is 'true'.
